Welcome

I am fascinated with the concept of communicative programming and as such am interested in the aesthetics of programming languages, domain specific languages and language oriented programming.

I believe that the pursuit of conceptual efficiency is at least as important as computational efficiency.

I am passionate about working in small teams of smart, motivated people. I treat my work as a craft, and seek opportunities to learn, develop and share skills with others. I believe in the value of open source software, and aim to make significant contributions to such projects.

I see software primarily as a form of communication that is not just limited to a conversation between a programmer and the computer but between many participants all of whom have an interest in understanding parts of the software.

I’m inspired to improve our ability to communicate, providing people with greater freedom to express themselves in order to collaborate and share their ideas together.

Innovation Factory

I work for Innovation Factory, a really great company full of very smart and motivated people based in Amsterdam.


We develop tools which we use to increase the innovative capacity and capabilities of our clients. We primarily develop with Ruby and use the most innovative set of technologies and methods we come across which currently includes Git, Behaviour Driven Development and a healthy mix of Agile.

Ioke

I'm a core contributor to the programming language Ioke.


Ioke is a seriously cool language optimised for expressiveness. It kicks ass over Ruby and Python in the same way they kick ass over Java and chums.

Music

I'm very interested with the combination of tactile interfaces and programming languages for making music.


Currenty I'm experimenting with a combination of a monome, a Novation ReMOTE ZeRO SL, Ioke, Ruby, SuperCollider and Clojure.
